data.title: Program
data.text:
Melissa Ceria

Founder, Studio Ceria

Melissa Ceria is a journalist and the founder of Studio Ceria, a boutique media agency that produces custom speaker series for companies. Through talks and conversations with thought leaders and entrepreneurs, Studio Ceria offers audiences access to innovative ideas, new networks and inspiring content. Melissa co-produces the international Art de Vivre talks at the French Institute Alliance FranÃ§aise in New York. Speakers she has presented include Oscar de la Renta, Carine Roitfeld, Tory Burch, Danny Meyer, Adam Gopnik, Bernard Tschumi, and Eric Ripert. In 2012-13, Melissa produced the speaker series for the International Academy of Television Arts & Sciences, which welcomes media executives from over 50 countries and 500 companies from all sectors of television, internet, mobile and technology. After starting her journalism career as the Eye Editor for Womenâs Wear Daily and W magazine, Melissa became a fashion writer for Harperâs Bazaar. Her writing on fashion, style, and design has been featured in The New York Times, Vogue, Time Style & Design, Elle Decor, Departures, and Travel + Leisure. Melissa graduated from Harvard University. She lives in Manhattan with her husband and their three children.

Alexandre Mars

Alexandre Mars est un serial entrepreneur visionnaire, spÃ©cialiste des nouvelles technologies et de la communication digitale. Ces quinze derniÃ¨res annÃ©es, il a lancÃ© puis revendu avec succÃ¨s plusieurs entreprises en France et aux Ãtats-Unis, et dans des secteurs variÃ©s comme le capital risque, lâInternet, le mobile, les rÃ©seaux sociaux et la publicitÃ©. RÃ©cemment, ses deux derniÃ¨res start-ups, Phonevalley (la plus importante agence mobile au monde) et ScrOOn (un systÃ¨me de gestion des mÃ©dias sociaux), ont Ã©tÃ© respectivement revendues Ã Publicis Omnicom Group et Blackberry. A 25 ans, il se lance dans une nouvelle aventure en crÃ©ant son propre fonds dâinvestissement, spÃ©cialisÃ© dans le secteur de lâInternet, et devient lâun des plus jeunes acteurs du capital risque au monde. ParallÃ¨lement, Alexandre est nommÃ© âDirecteur du Mobileâ de Publicis Groupe, permettant ainsi au troisiÃ¨me conglomÃ©rat mÃ©dias du monde de se positionner en leader de lâÃ¨re des communications mobiles. En 2007, Alexandre Mars se saisit dâune nouvelle opportunitÃ© Ã©mergeante : le Social Media. RÃ©guliÃ¨rement citÃ© dans le New York Times, The Wall Street Journal et Advertising Age, Alexandre Mars sâemploie Ã partager sa vision du mobile et du digital lors dâÃ©vÃ¨nements dÃ©diÃ©s Ã ces secteurs (MIT, CES, Advertising Week, OMMA, Digi:Day, AdTech, GSMA Mobile World Congress, New York Mobile Media Summit, European Media Leaders). Fabrice Sergent

Founcer & CEO, Cellfish

Un entrepreneur depuis toujours, Fabrice Sergent est le fondateur et CEO de Cellfish, lâun des plus grands Ã©diteurs de contenu numÃ©rique et dâapplications mobiles, comptant plus de 150 millions de fans de musique, de sport et de divertissement Ã travers le monde. Il est un entrepreneur issu du secteur des mÃ©dias et de lâInternet avec 20 ans dâexpÃ©rience. Il est basÃ© au siÃ¨ge de lâentreprise Ã New York. Sous la direction de Sergent, lâentreprise a menÃ© avec succÃ¨s trois acquisitions depuis sa crÃ©ation en 2004 : Bandsintown â lâapplication numÃ©ro 1 pour la dÃ©couverte de concerts avec plus de 10 millions dâutilisateurs â, ToneMedia â une plateforme de publicitÃ© digitale de premier plan construite uniquement autour de contenu musical, atteignant 120 millions dâutilisateurs chaque mois â, et Cellfish Studios (prÃ©cÃ©demment Airborne Mobile) â un Ã©diteur dâapplications mobiles. Aujourdâhui, Cellfish atteint prÃ¨s de 100 millions de dollars de chiffre dâaffaires et emploie une Ã©quipe mondiale de 240 personnes Ã travers le monde avec des bureaux Ã New York, San Diego, Paris, MontrÃ©al, et DÃ¼sseldorf. Sergent a siÃ¨ge Ã©galement au comitÃ© consultatif de la Mobile Giving Foundation, pour laquelle Cellfish fournit la plateforme de traitement de dons rapprochant organisations Ã but non lucratif et donateurs. En 1995, Sergent a Ã©tÃ© le fondateur, PrÃ©sident du comitÃ© et PDG de Club-Internet, lâun des premiers et plus importants fournisseurs dâaccÃ¨s Ã Internet franÃ§ais, rachetÃ© en 2000 par T-Online de Deutsche Telekom (le plus grand fournisseur dâaccÃ¨s Ã Internet en Europe) pour une transaction historique de 1,2 milliards dâeuros, un accord de premiÃ¨re importance dans la sphÃ¨re europÃ©enne des nouveaux mÃ©dias de lâÃ©poque. Entre 1998 et 2006, il a siÃ©gÃ© au conseil dâadministration de la filiale TV et radio de LagardÃ¨re (LagardÃ¨re Active). Sergent a Ã©galement siÃ©gÃ© au conseil de surveillance de T-Online pendant plusieurs annÃ©es, et aux conseils dâadministration dâEurope1 Interactive, Hachette Multimedia et Le Monde Interactif. Sergent est diplÃ´mÃ© dâun MBA de lâInstitut TÃ©lÃ©com. Il est mariÃ©, avec deux enfants et vit dans le comtÃ© de Westchester Ã New York.

Axelle Lemaire

SecrÃ©taire dâÃtat chargÃ©e du NumÃ©rique

Axelle Lemaire est SecrÃ©taire d'Ãtat chargÃ©e du NumÃ©rique auprÃ¨s d'Arnaud Montebourg, Ministre de l'Economie, du Redressement productif et du NumÃ©rique.

De nationalitÃ© franco-canadienne, elle a grandi au QuÃ©bec puis a rejoint la France Ã lâadolescence pour y suivre des Ã©tudes de lettres modernes (hypokhÃ¢gne), puis de sciences politiques (Ã lâInstitut dâÃtudes Politiques de Paris), avant de se spÃ©cialiser en droit (licence et maÃ®trise de droit privÃ© Ã lâUniversitÃ© Paris 1 PanthÃ©on-Sorbonne, DEA et Ã©tudes doctorales de droit international Ã lâUniversitÃ© dâAssas, Masters Ã Kingâs College London). Elle a exercÃ© le droit en tant que juriste internationale au sein de cabinets dâavocats et dâinstituts de recherche universitaire, puis travaillÃ© plusieurs annÃ©es Ã la Chambre des Communes comme collaboratrice parlementaire.

Elue dÃ©putÃ©e socialiste en juin 2012 pour reprÃ©senter Ã lâAssemblÃ©e nationale les FranÃ§ais Ã©tablis en Europe du Nord, sa circonscription inclut dix pays : le Royaume-Uni, lâIrlande, la SuÃ¨de, la Finlande, le Danemark, la NorvÃ¨ge, lâIslande, lâEstonie, la Lettonie et la Lituanie. Elle exerce au parlement les fonctions de SecrÃ©taire de la Commission des Lois, et siÃ¨ge Ã©galement Ã la Commission des affaires europÃ©ennes.

A lâAssemblÃ©e nationale, elle s'intÃ©resse Ã diffÃ©rents sujets souvent en lien avec les pays de la zone qu'elle reprÃ©sente: protection des droits fondamentaux et des libertÃ©s publiques, politique europÃ©enne, secteurs du numÃ©rique et de lâinnovation, entrepreneuriat, rÃ©gulation bancaire.

A la Commission des lois, elle a Ã©tÃ© successivement rapporteure pour avis de la loi bancaire, responsable pour le groupe socialiste dâune loi de transposition de directives et traits internationaux relatifs aux droits humains (Ã lâoccasion de laquelle ont Ã©tÃ© introduits les crimes dâesclavage et de travaux forcÃ©s dans le droit pÃ©nal), et responsable de la loi pour lâÃ©galitÃ© entre les femmes et les hommes.

A la Commission des affaires europÃ©ennes, elle est rapporteure sur le sujet du numÃ©rique. Elle a par ailleurs publiÃ© un rapport sur la stratÃ©gie europÃ©enne en matiÃ¨re de numÃ©rique, et fait adopter Ã lâunanimitÃ© une rÃ©solution parlementaire sur ce sujet Ã lâautomne 2013.

NommÃ©e PrÃ©sidente du groupe dâamitiÃ© parlementaire France/Grande-Bretagne et Irlande du Nord, elle continue dâentretenir un dialogue politique direct avec ses homologues britanniques, pour Åuvrer Ã la coopÃ©ration bilatÃ©rale et europÃ©enne et Ã lâamitiÃ© entre nos deux pays.

Le 9 avril 2014, elle a Ã©tÃ© nommÃ©e SecrÃ©taire d'Ãtat chargÃ©e du NumÃ©rique auprÃ¨s d'Arnaud Montebourg, Ministre de l'Economie, du Redressement productif et du NumÃ©rique.

Arun Sundararajan

Professor, NYU Stern

Arun Sundararajan is Professor and NEC Faculty Fellow at New York University's Leonard N. Stern School of Business. He also heads the Social Cities Initiative at NYU's Center for Urban Science+Progress, and is an affiliated faculty member at NYU's Center for Data Science. Professor Sundararajan's research program studies how digital technologies transform business and society. Some of his current and recent research focuses on the governance of digital spaces, collaborative consumption and the sharing economy, social media and cities, digital institutions, contagion in networks, privacy strategy, pricing in digital markets and managing online piracy. He has published in numerous scientific journals and has given more than 200 conference and invited presentations internationally. His research has been recognized by four Best Paper awards, been supported by organizations that include Yahoo!, Microsoft, Google and IBM, and recently profiled by trade publications that include The Atlantic, Bloomberg BusinessWeek, Fast Company, the Financial Times, Forbes, the San Francisco Chronicle and the Wall Street Journal. His op-eds and expert commentary have appeared in TIME Magazine, the New Yorker, the New York Times, Wired, TechCrunch, the Wall Street Journal, the Financial Times and Harvard Business Review, and on Al Jazeera, BBC News, Bloomberg, CNN, CNBC, Fox, NPR and PBS. He has served as Director of NYU Stern's IS Doctoral Program since 2007, and is one of the founders of the Workshop on Information in Networks. He holds degrees from the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras and the University of Rochester. Follow him on Twitter @digitalarun.

Manuel D. Medina

Founder & Managing Partner, Medina Capital

Manuel D. Medina est le fondateur et le Managing Partner de Medina Capital. Medina a plus de 30 ans dâexpÃ©rience et de rÃ©ussite en tant quâhomme dâaffaires avec une expertise dans des domaines tels que la technologie, la finance, le commerce international ou encore les contrats dâEtat. Medina a Ã©tÃ© le fondateur, prÃ©sident du conseil et CEO de Terremark Worldwide, Inc., une entreprise cotÃ©e en bourse au NASDAQ jusquâen avril 2011 lorsque Verizon Communications, Inc. A rachetÃ© lâentreprise. Sous sa direction, Terremark sâest diffÃ©renciÃ© comme le principal fournisseur mondial dâinfrastructure informatique aux entreprises Fortune 500 et aux agences fÃ©dÃ©rales amÃ©ricaines. Chez Terremark, Medina a apportÃ© sa vision pour fournir le meilleur service en infrastructure informatique sur mesure et provenant de data centers neutre vis-Ã -vis des opÃ©rateurs. Medina a dÃ©butÃ© sa carriÃ¨re en 1974 en tant quâexpert-comptable certifiÃ© chez PricewaterhouseCoopers. Il a fondÃ© Terremark en 1980 et a entrepris des projets dâinfrastructure complexes Ã travers les Ãtats-Unis, lâEurope, lâAmÃ©rique Latine, le Moyen-Orient et lâAsie. La vision de Medina a transformÃ© Terremark dâune entreprise dâimmobilier commercial en un leader mondial dans le milieu de la technologie. Son expÃ©rience Ã lever des fonds avec succÃ¨s au cours de pÃ©riodes de changements rapides dans lâenvironnement macroÃ©conomique a Ã©tÃ© vitale Ã la croissance de Terremark : il a levÃ© plus dâun milliard de dollars pour Terremark, a dÃ©ployÃ© ses services leader de lâindustrie Ã travers le monde, et a su mener lâentreprise Ã travers les environnements financiers dÃ©favorables en 2000 et 2008 jusquâÃ la vente Ã hauteur de 2 milliards de dollars Ã Verizon Communications, reprÃ©sentant ainsi Ã lâÃ©poque le multiplicateur dâEBITDA le plus Ã©levÃ© dans le secteur de lâinfrastructure informatique.Medina a Ã©tÃ© fÃ©licitÃ© par de nombreuses entreprises et organisations communautaires pour son leadership et service communautaire. Medina est Ã©galement rÃ©guliÃ¨rement invitÃ© Ã intervenir lors de confÃ©rences sur des sujets tels que les tendances technologiques, le commerce international ou encore lâentrepreneuriat. Lâexpertise de Medina dans lâindustrie tech et ses analyses pertinentes lâont amenÃ© Ã intervenir sur CNBC, Bloomberg TV et Fox Business ainsi quâau cours dâinterviews sur des chaines dâinformation internationales. Medina a reÃ§u son Bachelor of Science en ComptabilitÃ© de la Florida Atlatic University.

Alain Bankier

Partner, New York Angels

Alain Bankier, a serial entrepreneur and an active early stage investor, is currently incubating several new businesses in the food and education verticals. Until late 2013, Alain was Co-President and CEO of The Manischewitz Company. In 2002, Alain co-founded the Saveur Food Group (SFG) to create, acquire and build branded food companies and in 2008 Manischewitz was merged with SFG. In the mid 90âs, Alain was the co-founder of a leading New York based angel investment group, which was the precursor of the New York Angels. As a leading member of the New York Angels, Alain invests in a wide variety of technology, media and content companies, as well as companies in France and Israel. Alain is a board member/ advisor to a variety of companies and has been instrumental in achieving exit opportunities for several of these businesses. Combining his knowledge of the food industry and his experience in the tech and media startup world, Alain has been focusing on investment opportunities at the intersection of food, media and technology. Before his adventures in the food industry, Alain was a founder of an international boutique investment bank, which he sold to BNPParisbas and where he remained as the Head of Mergers and Acquisitions- Corporate Finance North Americas. Alain has a has a BA in Psychology from the University of Pennsylvania, a BS in Economics from The Wharton School and an MBA from New York University and from HEC, Paris.

Brian Cohen

Vice Chairman, New York Angels

As an angel investor and mentor to entrepreneurs, Brian serves as Chairman of the New York Angels, the #1 most active angel group in the country, with more than $95M invested into more that 100 early stage companies. Brian was the first investor in Pinterest, and numerous other industry leading startups. As a new author, Brianâs book entitled âWhat Every Angel Investor Wants You To Know: An Insider Reveals How To Get Smart Funding For Your Billion Dollar Ideaâ, was published and released by McGraw Hill in April 2013. As a social entrepreneur, Brian is the founding Board member of Center4, NYCâs first technology accelerator devoted to serving the non-profit community. As a disruptive media entrepreneur, Brian believes that all new products, services, and ideas should be easy to discover, find, share and buy. As a result, Brian co-founded Launch.it, with his son Trace in May 2012, the first direct-to-customer, event news and social engagement platform currently being used by the worldâs largest events to create a central location for all exhibitor and partner news. As a social medial specialist, Brian created iFluence PR in 2009, a strategic behavioral-based communications consultancy for the new earned influence / social media community. As a technology media communications strategist, Brian is considered one of the fathers of science & technology strategic communications, and co-founded Technology Solutions, Inc. with his wife Carol in 1983. TSI's client list read like an entrepreneurial Who's Who of startup technology companies in computing, communication, software, education, and entertainment. For more than a decade, Brian maintained a broad strategic communications partnership with Sony & IBM Corporation providing counsel to dozens of their new technology divisions. Notably, TSI received the Gold CIPRA Award in 1998 for the IBM Deep Blue/Gary Kasparov Chess Match Concept and Communications Program. In 1996, TSI was recognized as the #1 fastest growing agency in the U.S Brian sold the company to The McCann Erickson World Group in 1997 and became the Vice Chairman. As a researcher, Brian created Focus Technology, an organization that provided qualitative research and instituted the RPM model of integrated strategic communications providing ultra-competitive technology clients the ability to quickly discover and leverage their key strengths, as well as mitigate their destructive weaknesses. As a publisher, Brian was a pioneer in helping start a number of the first computing publications, to include Computer Systems News and InformationWeek Magazine. As an educator, Brian created the AIMS (Advanced Internet Media Studies) Program, a college semester program where students will be trained to use the internet smartly and professionally. He also advises entrepreneur students at NYU and Columbia University. As a recipient of the Distinguished Alumnus Award, Brian holds a Masters Degree in Science Communications from Boston University's School of Public Communications.

Marc-David Choukroun

Co-founder & CEO, The Food Assembly

Marc-David Choukroun is the co-founder and CEO at The Food Assembly. He grew up in Paris and started his career in 2004 as a project manager for Ogilvy Interactive, one of the leading web agencies in the world. There, he coordinated strategic projects for global brands such as NestlÃ©, Sephora or Louis Vuitton. In 2008, he launched his own web agency and started working with SMBâs and start-ups. In 2010, he met with Guilhem ChÃ©ron and together they launched The Food Assembly in September 2011 under the name La Ruche qui dit Oui ! The Food Assembly is a web platform enabling users to group themselves and buy food from their local farmers directly. Each Assembly is an autonomous community where consumers and farmers trade and interact directly. No need to go through traditional middlemen anymore. In June 2014, the network already accounts for more than 500 communities in France and Belgium, with over 50 000 consumers and 3 000 farmers trading directly and collaboratively. At the moment, the platform is launching in Germany, Spain and the United Kingdom and the start-up has great ambitions for the future : empower local communities everywhere in Europe and in the world.

Flore Vasseur

Fiction writer, freelance journalist, entrepreneur

At the age of 25, Flore Vasseur sets up her own market research boutique in New York. She surfs the Internet bubble, experiences a life-changing September 11th and its aftermath: a capitalist system in the verge of collapsing. Since then, she has been traveling to spot societal trends and find ways to tell the story of a world about to fail, and of another one about to emerge. She is consulted at C Suite level, organizes and takes part in conferences, directs documentaries, writes portraits, stories or columns for French media such as Le Monde, Canal Plus, Liberation and France Culture. A respected author of three fiction books, she is currently venturing into TV : she is screenwriting a series for RTS and will create and present her first TV show for Arte and TED called TED Stories (on air in December 2014). Flore focuses on globalization, challenges our relationship to consumption, performance, technology and power. She uses what she calls Â« Impact Fiction Â», to put at the core of the public debate some inconvenient questions: Who rules? What are we traded off for growth? What do freedom and success mean in a world about to perish? Throughout her three fiction books, she denounces the pure madness of a world dominated by Finance, by the unchallenged cult of technology and by the banality of renouncement. In parallel, she uses journalism and traditional media to shed the light on the disruptive thinkers and doers who may well create the world of tomorrow.She is all the more a master at dissecting the business elite and the so-called meritocratic system as she is a pure product of this system herself (she graduated in Politics and Business from HEC). A mother of two, she has been leaving in New York, Kabul, Paris and Lyon. Contact: vasseur.flore@gmail.com / www.florevasseur.com

Raouti Chehih

General Manager, Euratechnologies

Born in France, in 1971, Raouti has earned a PhD in Town and Country Planning. He is specialized in economic development and fundraising. After two years in the USA in the mid 90âs, where he worked on several projects in the field of economic development towards infrastructure projects (airport, mallsâ¦), he decided in 1994, with the rise of the .com industry, to specialize in digital industry and finance. He graduated from Stanford University (SCPD) in 2011 under the âinnovation and entrepreneurship programâ. In 1994, he launched Incubanet in Lille, a place to foster innovation and entrepreneurship in the emerging phases of the web industry, and joined DigiPort to drive the international development program for digital companies for the region (start-ups and SMEs export program development, fund raising, market assessment, partnership developmentâ¦). In 2003, he took the lead on Euratechnologiesâ strategic development plan and he now aims to develop one of the biggest incubators/accelerators in the world (25,000 sqm) in a textile factory dating from the 1900âs. Since 2011, Raouti is the CEO of Euratechnologies. From the start-up phase to an international business, Euratechnologies specializes in four areas: e-business & Pure Players, Information systems and software edition, Internet companies, and SMAC (Social, Mobile, Analytics and Cloud). Euratechnologies is welcoming young entrepreneurs with just an idea, start-ups, SMEs and big corporate players (Microsoft, CISCO, TATA, ASOS, Cap Gemini...) and is developing a unique entrepreneurship support center, providing access to technology transfers, to money, to talent and to specific markets. Launched in 2009, Euratechnologies represents today 140 tech businesses, 30 incubation projects each year, 60 start-up accelerator projects and more than 2,500 people working there everyday. Euratechnologies is also welcoming 300 tech events and more than 40,000 visitors each year. Euratechnologies is connected to a range of international partners all over the world to support the international development of its tech companies portfolio (Stanford University, Silicon Valley/New York, Dubai, Shanghai/Beijing, Belo Horizonte...).

Nihal Mehta

Founder, Eniac Ventures

With over 15 years of experience in marketing technologies through founding five start-ups and investing in over 100 since 1999, Nihal Mehta is a noted expert in the emerging adoption of mobile technologies for media properties and consumer brands. Nihal is a Founding General Partner at Eniac Ventures, the first seed stage venture fund focusing exclusively on mobile technologies. Prior to Eniac, Nihal founded LocalResponse, Inc., which makes ads more relevant from social signals, a pivot from buzzd, the first mobile real-time city guide. Nihal grew LocalResponse to an eight-digit annual revenue run rate which placed the company to the Forbes 2013 list as #67 of America's Most Promising Companies and #568 on the 2013 Inc. 5000's Fastest Growing Companies. Prior to LocalResponse, Nihal founded ipsh!, one of the first full-service mobile marketing agencies in 2001, which was acquired by Omnicom (NYSE: OMC) in 2005. Nihal's investment portfolio includes Admob (sold to Google), Airbnb, HotelTonight, Swiftkey, Tapad & Uber. Nihal graduated from the University of Pennsylvania with a BA in Philosophy and a BSE in Computer Science. He frequently guest lectures at business schools around the country on entrepreneurship and mobile marketing, and is published in over 15 books and white papers on the subject. In 2013, Nihal Mehta was named a semi-finalist for "Entrepreneur of the Year" by Ernst & Young, in 2012 a top 100 "Coolest People in NY Tech," by Business Insider, a "NYC tech influencer" by VentureBeat, one of the "25 People Every New Founder Should Meet in New York Tech" a top "25 Up-And-Coming Start-up CEO in New York" by Business Insider, and a 2012 AlwaysOn "Power Player NYC." Mehta was named a top 10 New York City "Game Changer" in the 2010 New York Enterprise Report, one of twenty RCR Wireless News "Mobile Movers and Shakers" in 2008, a BusinessWeek "M-Commerce Baron" in 2006 and named one of Ad Age's "Top 20 Marketers in Their 20s" in 2005.
